pip install pytrends
source.932835fb:
import pandas as pd
from pytrends.request import TrendReq
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
doge_trend = TrendReq()
source.c028cb45:
doge_trend.build_payload(kw_list=["Dogecoin"])
data_doge = doge_trend.interest_by_region()
data_doge = data_doge.sort_values(by="Dogecoin", ascending=False)
data_doge = data_doge.head(10)
print(data_doge)
source.a2d73f8d:
data_doge.reset_index().plot(x="geoName", y="Dogecoin", 
                        figsize=(20,18), kind="bar")
plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')
plt.show()
source.84b624c3:
data_doge = TrendReq(hl='en-US', tz=360)
data_doge.build_payload(kw_list=['Dogecoin'])
data_doge = data_doge.interest_over_time()
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(20, 15))
data_doge['Dogecoin'].plot()
plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')
plt.title('Total Google Searches for Dogecoin', fontweight='bold')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Total Count')
plt.show()

In this case, i want to know how we can know detect popularity of dogecoin time to time. Hope this notebook are going to be enjoy by all of you and at the same time i'm trying to increase my skill in analyzing and creating something new.

source.a79222c4: After importing all package, here I will be analyzing the Google search trends on the queries based on “Dogecoin”, so let’s create a DataFrame of the top 10 countries which search for “Dogecoin” on Google Search
